title: Calories in an Old Fashioned
meta_description: Discover calories in an old fashioned cocktail, including carbs, alcohol content, full nutrition breakdown, and recipe tweaks for lower calories.
assumptions: Standard recipe: 2 oz bourbon whiskey, 1 tsp simple syrup (or sugar cube), 2-3 dashes Angostura bitters, orange twist; stirred with ice, served over ice; no extra garnishes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by liquor brand, exact pour size, sweetener type, and additions like cherries or soda; check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: One standard Old Fashioned cocktail contains about 155 kcal, mostly from the bourbon.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts style, focusing on key macros; alcohol calories are included in total kcal.

tweaks.label: Use 1.5 oz bourbon instead of 2 oz
Add a maraschino cherry and splash of soda

faqs.q: How many calories in an old fashioned cocktail?
faqs.a: Approximately 155 kcal for a standard serving with 2 oz bourbon and simple syrup.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an Old Fashioned?
faqs.a: About 4.2 g carbs, all from sugars in the simple syrup; no fiber.

faqs.q: Does the type of whiskey affect calories in an old fashioned?
faqs.a: Slightlyâ€”bourbon is around 70 kcal per oz, but rye or scotch may vary by 5-10 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie versions of an old fashioned?
faqs.a: Yes, use diet sweetener and less bourbon to drop to ~100-120 kcal.

faqs.q: How much alcohol is in an old fashioned?
faqs.a: Typically 2 oz (about 1.5 standard drinks) of 40% ABV whiskey, contributing most of the calories.
